title: Authors and Citation
text: Hyun S, Coleman T, Ribalet F, Bien J (2025). flowtrend: flowtrend. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {flowtrend: flowtrend},   author = {Sangwon Hyun and Tim Coleman and Francois Ribalet and Jacob Bien},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: flowtrend
text: R software package implements flowtrend (Hyun, Coleman, Ribalet, Bien 2025), mixture experts model using trend filtering, specialized high-frequency flow cytometry data collected time/space.

title: flowtrend
text: can install flowtrend package using following command:

text: sigma covariance padding small amount padding add weighted densities. Note, small value (like 1E-20) used, otherwise probabilitistic (soft) gating can affected quite noticably.

what: Estimate maximum lambda values numerically. First starts with a large initial value max_lambda_mean and max_lambda_prob, and runs the EM algorithm on decreasing set of values (sequentially halved). This stops once you see non-simple probabilities or means, and returns the smallest regularization (lambda) value pair that gives full sparsity. — calc_max_lambda
title: Estimate maximum lambda values numerically. First starts with a large initial value max_lambda_mean and max_lambda_prob, and runs the EM algorithm on decreasing set of values (sequentially halved). This stops once you see non-simple probabilities or means, and returns the smallest regularization (lambda) value pair that gives full sparsity. — calc_max_lambda
text: Note zero_stabilize=TRUE option used flowtrend(), basically means EM algorithm runs zero pattern stabilizes.

title: Estimate maximum lambda values numerically. First starts with a large initial value max_lambda_mean and max_lambda_prob, and runs the EM algorithm on decreasing set of values (sequentially halved). This stops once you see non-simple probabilities or means, and returns the smallest regularization (lambda) value pair that gives full sparsity. — calc_max_lambda
code: calc_max_lambda(   ylist,   countslist = NULL,   numclust,   max_lambda_mean = 4000,   max_lambda_prob = 1000,   verbose = FALSE,   iimax = 16,   ... )

title: Estimate maximum lambda values numerically. First starts with a large initial value max_lambda_mean and max_lambda_prob, and runs the EM algorithm on decreasing set of values (sequentially halved). This stops once you see non-simple probabilities or means, and returns the smallest regularization (lambda) value pair that gives full sparsity. — calc_max_lambda
text: ylist List responses. numclust Number clusters. max_lambda_mean Defaults 4000. max_lambda_prob Defaults 1000. iimax Maximum value x 2^-x factors try. ... arguments flowtrend_once().

title: Estimate maximum lambda values numerically. First starts with a large initial value max_lambda_mean and max_lambda_prob, and runs the EM algorithm on decreasing set of values (sequentially halved). This stops once you see non-simple probabilities or means, and returns the smallest regularization (lambda) value pair that gives full sparsity. — calc_max_lambda

what: Cross-validation for flowtrend(). Saves results to separate files in destin. — cv_flowtrend
title: Cross-validation for flowtrend(). Saves results to separate files in destin. — cv_flowtrend
text: Cross-validation flowtrend(). Saves results separate files destin.

title: Cross-validation for flowtrend(). Saves results to separate files in destin. — cv_flowtrend
code: cv_flowtrend(   ylist,   countslist,   x = NULL,   destin = ".",   lambda_means,   lambda_probs,   l,   l_prob,   iimat = NULL,   maxdev,   numclust,   nfold,   blocksize,   nrestart,   verbose = FALSE,   refit = FALSE,   save_meta = FALSE,   mc.cores = 1,   folds = NULL,   seedtab = NULL,   niter = 1000,   ... )

title: Cross-validation for flowtrend(). Saves results to separate files in destin. — cv_flowtrend
text: ylist Data. countslist Counts corresponding multiplicities. x Times, points evenly spaced. Defaults NULL, case value becomes 1:T, $T==length(ylist)$. destin Directory output files saved. lambda_means Regularization parameters means. lambda_probs Regularization parameters probs. l Degree differencing mean trend filtering. l=0 give piecewise constant means; l=1 piecewise linear, forth. l_prob Degree differencing probability trend filtering. maxdev Maximum deviation cluster means across time.. numclust Number clusters. nfold Number cross-validation folds. Defaults 5. blocksize Contiguous time blocks form CV time folds. nrestart Number repetitions. verbose Loud ? EM iteration progress printed. refit TRUE, estimate model full data, pair regularization parameters. save_meta TRUE, save meta data. mc.cores Use many CPU cores. folds Manually provide CV folds (list time points data use CV folds). Defaults NULL. niter Maximum number EM iterations. ... Additional arguments flowtrend().

title: Cross-validation for flowtrend(). Saves results to separate files in destin. — cv_flowtrend
text: return.

title: flowtrend — flowtrend-package
text: package implements flowtrend method automatic gating flow cytometry data using trend filtering. proposed https://arxiv.org/abs/2504.12287.  learn package, please visit website https://sangwon-hyun/flowtrend-project.

text: ylist Data. countslist Counts corresponding multiplicities. x Times, points evenly spaced. Defaults NULL, case value becomes 1:T, $T==length(ylist)$. numclust Number clusters. niter Maximum number EM iterations. l Degree differencing mean trend filtering. l=0 give piecewise constant means; l=1 piecewise linear, forth. l_prob Degree differencing probability trend filtering. mn Initial value cluster means. Defaults NULL, case initial values randomly chosen data. lambda Smoothing parameter means lambda_prob Smoothing parameter probabilities verbose Loud ? EM iteration progress printed. tol_em Relative numerical improvement objective value stop EM algorithm maxdev Maximum deviation cluster means across time.. admm_local_adapt_niter
